text: The first shipment of Molnupiravir arrived in the country last Nov. 17, the first in Southeast Asia. We are truly humbled & grateful to QualiMed Health Network for trusting us with this partnership, helping us extend our reach to more kababayans in need. Maraming salamat po!

In the agreement, the OVP will issue a guarantee letter under our special medical assistance program to any qualified patient referred by our volunteer doctors at Bayanihan E-Konsulta. QualiMed facilities will then further assess and prescribe the medicine to the patient.

Molnupiravir, an oral pill for the treatment of mild to moderate cases of COVID-19, is now available for our Bayanihan E-Konsulta patients who may be prescribed to take them. 

Today, we signed a Memorandum of Agreement with QualiMed Health Network on providing this assistance. https://t.co/KKPyut4ojq

Buong-buo ang tiwala ko: Magtatagumpay tayo. Buong-buo pa rin ang pananalig ko sa Diyos at sambayanang Pilipino.

Maraming salamat. Mabuhay ang Pilipinas.

[end]
Kung saan ang lakas ng bawat isa ay nagiging nagkakaisang lakas ng lahat-- lakas na dadaig sa anumang krisis, anumang hamon, lakas na magiging simula ng ating kolektibong pagbangon.
Sama-sama tayong tumaya sa laban na ito. Buong bansa tayong tumungo sa isang kinabukasang mas patas at mas makatao; kung saan ang bawat Pilipino ay may pagkakataong umasenso;
Heto ako ngayon, humahakbang. Ipaglalaban ko kayo hanggang dulo. Itataya ko ang lahat; ibubuhos ko ang lahat ng kayang ibuhos.

Hindi ito puwedeng iasa sa iba habang nanonood ka lang; hindi puwedeng pumikit na lang at umasang pagdilat natin nagbago na ang mundo. Ang kinabukasan, pinipili, pinagsisikapan, ipinaglalaban. Kailangan nating piliing humakbang.
May landas tungo sa kinabukasang ito. Pero hindi ito maaabot sa pagwawalang-kibo kapag may nangyayaring hindi tama.

Kung saan ang mga plano para sa edukasyon, transportasyon, pagkain, kalusugan, katarungang panlipunan, ay naipapatupad dahil may gobyernong matino at mahusay; gobyernong tapat at may pananagutan; gobyernong tunay na inuuna ang interes ng taumbayan.
Isang lipunan kung saan kapag nagbanat ka ng buto, kapag ginawa mo ang lahat ng kaya mo, makaasa ka sa ginhawa at pag-asenso; kung saan kapag nadapa ka, may sasalo sa iyo, may aakay sa iyo patayo.
Panata ko ngayon: Ibubuhos ko nang buong-buo ang aking lakas, hindi lang hanggang sa halalan kundi hanggang sa mga natitirang araw ko, para ipaglaban ang Pilipinas ng ating mga pangarap:
Anim na taon ang nakaraan, tinanggap ko ang hamon na tumakbo sa pagka-Bise Presidente. Ngayon, sasabak tayo sa mas malaking laban.

Kahit ginigipit tayo, imagine kung ano pa ang kaya nating gawin, kung saan pa ang kaya nating marating, kung maitututok ang buong enerhiya ng gobyerno sa tangi nitong dapat iniintindi: Ang kapakanan ng taumbayan.
Kung naipatupad natin ang lahat ng ito; kung nakarating ang tulong natin sa Agutaya, hanggang San Remigio, hanggang sa ground zero ng Marawi

ang Vaccine Express, at Swab Cab, at Bayanihan e-konsulta, at Bayanihan e-skuwela, at Trabahope, at Community Mart, at free shuttle, at mga libreng PPE at napakarami pang ibang nagawa gamit ang pinagsanib nating lakas.
Ang mga pabahay, ang ayuda at medical at livelihood assistance, ang lingap sa mga nasalanta, ang pailaw at classroom at dorm;

Ihayag ang katotohanan na sa kabila ng mga limitasyon, sa kabila ng panggigipit, sa maliit na tanggapan pa lang natin dito sa Office of the Vice President, napakarami na nating nagawa para makatulong:
Tumindig kayo; tinitiyak ko, mayroon ding titindig sa tabi ninyo. Kumausap ng labas sa nakasanayan; palawakin pa ang hanay.

Alam kong marami sa inyo ang ilang buwan nang kumikilos nang kusa tungo sa layuning ito. Ramdam na ramdam ko ang tiwalang kaloob ninyo sa akin. Sinasabi ko ngayon: Buong-buo rin ang tiwala ko sa inyo. Tinatawag ko kayo: Gisingin ang natutulog pang lakas.
Tatalunin natin ang luma at bulok na klase ng pulitika. Ibabalik natin sa kamay ng karaniwang Pilipino ang kakayahang magdala ng pagbabago.

Dito tayo pupusisyon. Yung pagod; yung pakiramdam na parang wala kang kalaban-laban, na parang nagawa mo na ang lahat pero kulang pa rin; yung pagnanasang makaraos ng taumbayan, bibigyan natin ng bago at positibong anyo; gagawin natin itong paninindigan, gagawin nating enerhiya.
Pero hindi kayang tabunan ng kahit na anong ingay ang katotohanan: Kung parehong uri ng pamamahala at pareho ang pagkatao ng mga magwawagi sa araw ng halalan, wala tayong aasahang pagbabago.
Nasa kanila ang pera, makinarya, isang buong istrukturang kayang magpalaganap ng anumang kuwentong gusto nilang palaganapin.
Malinaw sa lahat ang hamon na kinakaharap natin. Nakita na nating lahat ang pagsisinungaling at panggigipit na kayang gawin ng iba para maabot ang mga layunin nila.

Buong-buo ang loob ko ngayon: Kailangan nating palayain ang sarili mula sa kasalukuyang situwasyon. Lalaban ako; lalaban tayo. 

Inihahain ko ang aking sarili bilang kandidato sa pagkapangulo sa halalan ng 2022.

Ina akong nakikita ang pagdurusa ng minamahal kong bansa. Naniniwala ako: Ang pag-ibig, nasusukat hindi lang sa pagtitiis, kundi sa kahandaang lumaban, kahit gaano kahirap,  para matapos na ang pagtitiis. Ang nagmamahal, kailangang ipaglaban ang minamahal.

At naaalala ko kapag sa wakas, pinili nilang lumaya-- kapag nahanap nila ang tapang na mag-empake, bitbitin ang mga bata, at gawin ang unang hakbang papalabas ng pinto nila. Dahil natauhan sila na kung hindi sila maglalakas ng loob, mamanahin lang ng mga anak nila ang pagdurusa.

Naaalala ko nga 'yung maraming kaso ng domestic abuse na hinawakan ko noong nag-aabogado pa ako. Kung paanong tiniis ng mga kliyente ko ang pang-aabuso at pananakit ng asawa nila. Kapag tinanong mo kung bakit, iisa ang sagot: Alang-alang sa mga anak nila.

Nanay ako hindi lang ng tatlong anak ko, kundi ng buong bansa. At alam ng lahat ng ibang nanay, ng lahat ng ibang magulang, kung ano ang kaya nilang pagdaanan at isakripisyo sa ngalan ng kanilang mga anak.

Iba-iba man ang konteksto natin, pamilyar sa ating lahat ang pakiramdam ng pagiging nasa laylayan; ang paghahanap ng makakapitan, 'yung handa kang kumatok sa kahit saang pintuan, 'yung halos isigaw mo sa kahit sinong makakarinig: Tulong.
Malinaw kung nasaan ako: Nasa panig tayo ng mga sinasagad ang lahat para iraos ang sarili, ang pamilya, ang kapwa, mula sa pandemyang ito.
Kung hindi ka lilinya nang malinaw; kung makikipagkompromiso ka; kung hindi mo man lang kayang sabihin na mali ang mali-- na kaninong panig ka ba talaga?
Handa dapat tayong iwaksi nang buong-buo ang mga agenda, ang mga interes, ang mismong mga tao at klase ng pulitika na sanhi ng pinagdaraanan ng bansa ngayon.

At kung gusto nating tunay na makalaya sa ganitong situwasyon, hindi lang apelyido ng mga nasa poder ang dapat palitan; 'yung korupsyon, 'yung incompetence, 'yung kawalan ng malasakit, kailangang palitan ng matino at mahusay na pamumuno.

Alam na nating lahat ito: Kaya maraming nagugutom, naghihirap, at namamatay, dahil sariling interes at hindi kapakanan ng Pilipino ang number one priority ng mga nasa poder. Ang kawalan ng maayos na pamamahala ang ugat ng ating mga problema, at ito ang kailangang wakasan.

Samantala, bilyon-bilyong piso ang inilalagay sa mga kuwestiyonableng kontrata habang milyon-milyong Pilipino ang naghihikahos.

[Watch it here: https://t.co/KphBDXksa3]
Nilinaw ko rin: Buhay at kinabukasan ng Pilipino ang pinag-uusapan natin ngayon. Pinipilahan ang mga ospital, dumadaing ang mga healthworkers, at nagugutom ang mga nawalan ng trabaho.

Ang tugon ko, hindi ito tungkol sa pusisyon; hindi tayo nakikipag-usap para makipagtransaksyon. Ang pinakamahalaga, magkaisa kami-- sa prinsipyo, sa pangarap para sa bansa, at sa landas na dapat tahakin tungo sa katuparan ng mga ito. 

[Watch it here: https://t.co/KphBDXksa3]

Nitong mga nakaraang linggo, nakipagpulong tayo sa iba't ibang mga personalidad. Nilinaw ko sa kanila: Handa akong magbigay-daan at tumulong na lang. May alok din silang sumanib na lang ako-- bilang kandidato, o bilang bahagi ng kanilang administrasyon sakaling manalo sila.

Mahaba ang daang tinahak natin para makarating sa araw na ito. Hindi ko binalak tumakbo. Iniisip ko nang bumalik na lang sa probinsya namin, kung saan marami rin ang umaasa sa aking tumulong magpanday ng pagbabago. 

[Watch it here: https://t.co/KphBDXksa3]

Lalong matimbang ang tanong na ito dahil sa napakalaking hamon ng pandemya. Ang dami nang namatay. Marami sa atin, ginawa na ang lahat ng puwedeng gawin para lang mailigtas ang mga mahal sa buhay; para makahanap ng pambili ng pagkain; para maitawid ang sarili sa kinabukasan.

Pagdating sa pamumuno, iisa lang dapat ang konsiderasyon: Ano ba ang pinakamabuti para sa bansa natin?

 [Watch it here: https://t.co/KphBDXksa3]
Sa prosesong ito, walang naging lugar ang ego o pansarili kong interes. Mabigat na responsibilidad ang pagka-Pangulo, at hindi ito puwedeng ibase sa ambisyon o sa pag-uudyok ng iba.

Puno ng taimtim na pagninilay ang nakaraang mga araw. Salamat sa lahat ng nagparating ng suporta, sumabay sa dasal, at umunawa sa pinagdaanan kong discernment process ukol sa halalan ng 2022. 

[Watch it here: https://t.co/KphBDXksa3]

Hinihikayat ko ang lahat ng ating kababayan na isama sa kanilang mga panalangin ang lahat ng pasahero ng eroplanong bumagsak, ang kanilang mga pamilya, at ang mga patuloy na kumikilos para sa search and retrieval operations.
Buo ang aking tiwala sa AFP at iba pang ahensiya na kasalukuyang nagsasagawa ng search and retrieval operations. Handang tumulong ang aming tanggapan sa anumang paraan kung kinakailangan.

Salamat sa pag-unawa! Resume po ulit ang Bayanihan E-konsulta natin sa Tuesday, 7am. üôè

Naiimagine ko nga‚Äîkung kami na nag-o-augment lang ng capacity ganito na ang pagka-overwhelm, paano pa kaya ‚Äòyung mga healthcare workers sa mga ospital? Tuloy ang prayers natin para sa kanila, sa COVID patients, pati na rin gratitude sa lahat ng tumutulong sa ating volunteers.

Gusto pa nating magpatuloy ang programa, at makatulong sa mas marami pang tao, kaya we need a day to work through our backlogs with the help of our external volunteers and make our system even more responsive, including fixing all technical issues.

Magreresume ulit tayo ng pagtanggap ng bagong requests 7 AM on Tuesday, April 13.

Humihingi ako ng paumanhin at pang-unawa sa lahat. Binanggit ko ito before we launched‚Äîbitin tayo sa resources, at malinaw na sobrang dami talaga ng taong kailangang kumonsulta sa doktor remotely.

Isang araw lang po ito. Kailangan lang po namin ng panahon para ma integrate na yung external volunteers at maayos lahat na technical issues at backlogs. Hindi po namin inaasahan ang dagsa ng nagkukunsulta kaya kailangan lalong paghusayan ang ating platform at process flow.

Hindi kami nagpapigil kahit ang daming limitasyon, at kailangan namin ngayon ng kaunting oras para habulin at tugunan muna ang lahat ng pumasok na request.

Kaya, despite our reluctance to do so, tomorrow, Monday, April 12, we will not be receiving new requests first.
Sobrang overwhelming ang support, at sobrang overwhelming din ang dami ng requests na pinaabot sa atin. Patunay ito na kailangang natin ng ganitong uri ng serbisyo.

7. WHAT INDIVIDUALS CAN DO ‚Äî h. Yung mga kaya nating maiambag para maisakatuparan ang suggestions sa itaas, kahit pa gaano kaliit, will be most welcome. Lahat na iba pang suggestions ay welcome din para mapag aralan.

7. WHAT INDIVIDUALS CAN DO

a. Huwag nang lumabas, please, unless absolutely necessary.

b. Kung lalabas: Face mask at face shield, hugas ng kamay. Physical distancing palagi.

c. Monitor your symptoms. Kung masama ang pakiramdam, mag-isolate muna.

6. REINTEGRATION ‚Äî c. Aim for herd immunity by end of 2021. More than 70% of population vaccinated.

d. Ayuda for businesses, those who lost jobs, those who suddenly became underemployed, livelihood assistance, etc

6. REINTEGRATION

a. Vaccine rollout ‚Äì more aggressive communications campaign to improve vaccine trust

b. Assist LGUs for more efficient vaccine rollout. Sana ma-expand at ma strengthen-- supply chain, logistics, etc. Private sector participation should be encouraged, maximized
5. TREATMENT ‚Äî e. Stack up on the necessary medicines and medical equipment that are needed in treating Covid 19 patients.

5. TREATMENT‚Äî c. Hire more doctors, nurses, and other health personnel with compensation commensurate to their efforts and sacrifices.

d. If necessary, recruit from provinces with low transmission rates but offer attractive packages, fly them to Manila, give free accommodations.

5. TREATMENT

a. Site and hotline that would be available 24/7 for people needing hospitalizations, quarantine/isolation areas, etc. Updates should be real time.

b. Set up field hospitals strategically. Additional number of beds should be based on needs assessment.

4. ISOLATION ‚Äî c. For those with capacity to self isolate at home, make sure medical help is available - doctors to call, COVID kits, basic medical equipment in brgy health centers that they have immediate access to, ambulance available anytime that people don‚Äôt have to pay for.
4. ISOLATION ‚Äî b. For the vulnerable, make sure that there is support for the family when one is in isolation. Ito usually ang dahilan kung bakit may resistance sa isolation.

4. ISOLATION

a. Make sure that we have enough well-equipped, well-ventilated, comfortable isolation centers to handle those who will test positive with no capacity to self-isolate at home.
3. TRACING ‚Äî e. Set goals. Before, Mayor Magalong said ideal is 1:37. I understand, currently, we‚Äôre just accomplishing 1:3, even less in NCR.

3. TRACING ‚Äî c. Use Staysafe app or whatever is the standard app to unify or centralize contact tracing. All LGUs that already have different contact tracing apps should be connected to Staysafe. 

d. Have a centralized repository of contact tracing data.

3. TRACING

a. Utilize BHERTs to do immediate contact tracing once antigen test results become available.

b. Do immediate antigen testing to those who were contact traced.

2. TESTING ‚Äî b. Incentivize people to have themselves tested.

10. Having mobile testing centers where people can have themselves tested for free will greatly help control the transmission of the virus. This is easily replicable. We will post tomorrow what are needed to operationalize something like this in your own communities.

One way is to give cash assistance equivalent to at least the minimum wage for every day that they are not able to work because they are isolated. Yung problema namin sa OVP, wala kaming resources for this kaya kailangan talagang maghanap ng paraan;

Since there are many asymptomatic patients / displaying very mild symptoms, we will not be able to control transmission with many of them still going around, possibly infecting others. So we need to seriously think how we can incentivize people to convince them to get tested.

9. The resistance to undergo swab testing is real. People are worried that if they test positive and are required to isolate, they will not be able to work and their families might go hungry. Delikado ito.
8. We already gave COVID 19 Safety Kits to all those swabbed earlier. Tomorrow, we will be providing food packs to families of the Covid -positive patients who needed to isolate;

6. Per agreed protocols, they will immediately be isolated and confirmatory RT PCR tests will be conducted tomorrow (DOH announced just now that those who tested positive through antigen tests will be counted in the tally of Covid 19 cases. So we will need to meet again on this);

4. We were ready to test 1,500 people. But BHERTs had a hard time convincing people. Most of those who refused were worried they would be required to isolate if found positive. We were only able to test 502;

5. 34 were positive. 12 who tested negative displaying symptoms;

7. Of course, these numbers will adjust depending on the results of the surveillance testing. But we need to do it now.

6. While absolute numbers in Cagayan Valley are small compared to NCR, per capita numbers are high; positivity rate highest at 28.94%. This means that for every 4 being tested, more than one is Covid-positive. A minimum of 3,860 tests per day is needed for 5% positivity rate;
5. Based on the table, in NCR alone, we need about 90,000 tests per day. Here, positivity rate is 20.17%. This means for every 5 tests, 1 turns out positive;

4. WHO standard is positivity rate should be less than 5%. We need to have that as our target. Last column in the table shows our recommended number of tests per day per region, based on the March 26 numbers. We will do this on a daily basis as the reports come in;

3. Right now, we‚Äôre conducting between 30,000-50,000 tests per day all over the country. But if you look at the table, the positivity rates for some regions are so high that the number of tests we are conducting are no longer enough;

2. Using just the 6,936 positive cases, we are recommending the minimum number of tests that should be conducted per day per region. Better sana if by LGU but there is no disaggregated data available per town/city/province on the tests conducted;

Another Sunday suggestion re TESTING: Increase testing but let‚Äôs make it more targeted.

We will using FDA-approved antigen test with high efficacy rate. First batch of tests will be from privately-donated funds. But our office is ready to appropriate funds for more if urgently needed.
We have been working on this project last week to help combat the surge. Thanks to our partners for making this possible.
Hopefully this will prevent those asymptomatic and who have not yet been tested from further transmitting the virus.
All those who will test positive will already be isolated and subjected to RT PCR test.
Existing RT PCR tests usually are for those with symptoms or have been contact traced. We will do antigen testing to target those without symptoms and no known exposure to Covid positive cases.

7. Our problem at hand is huge. We have to deal with this collectively. Huwag sana masamain ang suggestions.

Hindi sapat yung binigay natin dati. Magandang halimbawa dito ang Malaysia. Naging sobrang masama din yung cases nila when they started to reopen. But they were able to arrest the situation. Maraming ginawa to achieve this. Isa doon, 6 nang stimulus packages yung naibigay nila;

6. ‚ÄúSumunod nalang kasi kayo‚Äù. Madali lang ito sabihin if you are speaking from a position of privilege. Pero kung wala ka nang ipapakain sa pamilya mo, lalabas ka pa din kahit nakakatakot.

Stimulus package, pleaseüôè Ayuda para sa mga nawalan ng trabaho at kita.

There are best practices, like Indonesia and India. Okay to have rules and parameters, pero don‚Äôt make it too difficult. For every Filipino who gets the vaccine, the entire community benefits. 

Same for LGUs‚Äîcapacitate those who want to invest in vaccines for their constituents;

5. Private sector is a big help. Sana let us not over regulate. Let us not make it difficult for private companies to participate. Wala sigurong problema for bigger companies. But for smaller businesses who only want to make their employees safe, huwag na masyadong pahirapan pa.

Totoo na problema pa ang supply. Pero yung konting supply na dumating, hindi pa natin ma deploy with speed and dispatch. Let us assess where the bottlenecks are. 1M palang supply natin, pero in 17 days hindi pa nga tayo naka 50% utilization, papaano na kung 70M na yung available?

4. Sec Duque said we can‚Äôt rush innoculating our health frontliners kasi mauubos tao sa ospital kung sabay sabay sila tuturukan. 

Our ask since last year: prepare deployment plan, treat it as a logistics problem, identify and train vaccinators, prepare large vaccination centers.

3. Govt target is herd immunity by the end of the year. Herd immunity is 70% of the population. 70% of 105M people is 73,500,000. If we have about 286 remaining days in 2021, we should innoculate 256,993 people per day. We are so far off the target at the rate we are going now;

2. We need to improve our vaccine rollout.  Per DOH numbers, for the period March 1-17, 269,583 health frontliners were innoculated. That is just 23.95%. At this rate, we are only averaging 15,857 per day;

Amid the many problems we still have to solve, as we move forward as a nation, we find hope in you. I and the OVP are committed to continue supporting you. Sama-sama tayo sa pagsulong sa pangarap na mapagtagumpayan ang laban na ito.

Sa ating mga frontliners: Maraming, maraming salamat sa serbisyo at sakripisyo. Isang taon na, at alam kong nakakapagod. Alam kong nakakaubos magbigay ng sarili, lalo na‚Äôt matindi pa rin ang ating laban. Pero sa inyong pagpupursige kami humuhugot ng lakas.

Over the past year, we have lost hundreds of our medical frontliners in this fight. Grateful that their community carries on despite the sacrifices it calls for‚Äîso that we can reach the safer, healthier nation we aspire for.

We owe so much to our valiant health frontliners, who are closest to the dangers of COVID-19 every day. Their courage and their heart reverberate across hospitals and health centers, in testing centers, in barangay clinics and down at the communities. https://t.co/Q9fbjYY1yx

A year into lockdown and we‚Äôve weathered through so much: thousands of deaths and cases, millions of jobs and chances lost, many moments of confusion, uncertainty, and fears.

We arrived Cagayan this morning. Our team arrived a few hours earlier with supplies. Situation is so much better. Many areas still flooded but water receded already.

Update from our team:

All requests coursed through us forwarded to Tuguegarao Rescue 111.  We were just informed that they suspended rescue ops for the meantime because of zero visibility and strong waves and current. Will resume as soon as conditions become more favorable.
We will get back to you as soon as we get hold of them. We will be coordinating with people who are on the ground.

Our Cagayan Relief Ops continues. All the calls for rescue have been reported to the rescue teams and many of them have been rescued already. Those who lost touch with relatives and need help, pls make sure you send us their complete names, addresses and tel numbers.
Was informed by our team that two choppers already took off from Clark about an hour ago. After prepositioning in Cauayan City, air rescue will already commence.

Update from our team: Fi sir mam yung sa Rodriguez Rizal stroke patient relayed to AFP Comnd Ctr,  yung Stage 4 cancer patient  relayed to ground units of Coast Guard operating in Marikina..rqstd to prioritize for Medevac
All calls for rescue are noted and sent to the different rescue teams. Thank you to Mayor Fresnedi of Muntinglupa for offering to lend their two rubber boats. We‚Äôre looking for more who can lend.
Crowdsourcing for rubber boats which can be lent to LGUs overwhelmed with calls for rescue.

Spent the entire night answering calls for rescue in Bicol. Many people trapped by floodwaters inside their houses.  Complaints that they were not warned enough. Same thing is happening here now -Marikina, Rizal, etc.

Bicol was badly battered for the third time this month. Praying for those who lost their lives, lost their homes, lost their livelihood. Hope the destruction in all the other regions will not be as bad. Keep safe, everyoneüôèüèª
Requesting for prayers for our rescuers, barangay officials, tanods, uniformed men and everyone else still out there risking their lives to save others.

Long day, long night, monitoring trapped residents, extreme flooding, cries for help.  Everyone is saying there was too much rain, the typhoon hovered for too long and Ulysses was unexpectedly strong.
lols https://t.co/oXk4SOPcwX
‚ÄúThe arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice‚Äù. MLK quote very apt to many of the things happening now.

My warmest congratulations to President-elect @JoeBiden and VP-elect @KamalaHarris! Your victory is an affirmation of the shared ideals on which the long friendship between our two nations stand: democracy, civil rights, faith, and inclusivity. I pray for your success!

More visits to check on areas affected by #RollyPH. Back in Punta Tarawal, a remote village in Calabanga reachable only by boat. Despite the circumstances, its people were as welcoming. Glad to see improvements, like the sea wall that helped a lot in protecting the barangay. https://t.co/0Yk2lS64Wh

We arrived late afternoon in Brgy. Sabang, San Jose, one of our Community Learning Hub pilot areas. Another coastal community where many lost their homes to the typhoon. 

Our hub had minor damage, but our volunteers kept supplies safe and will resume assisting learners soon. https://t.co/hPibDTk6YX

We then went to Brgy. San Jose in Bula, which is near a lake and a river. Parts of the community‚Äîand the town‚Äîare still flooded.

Also made a quick stop at Iriga City Hall to check with the LGU how the town is doing. https://t.co/cdQDt3LlSs

CamSur rounds today, to check on more communities which were severely affected by #RollyPH.

1st stop was Brgy. Salingogon in Minalabac‚Äîa long ride from the town proper, along an uneven road. Like many coastal communities, houses by the sea were heavily damaged. https://t.co/CgbHk2smND

We've been receiving many msgs asking for updates from Catanduanes. They only have a satellite equipment that provides internet to the Prov'l Capitol. You may send msgs to your families via Gov. Boboy Cua's FB page (https://t.co/ZH5BftMTse). They have a team in charge of this. https://t.co/j0CEdxVbm6

Amid all the damage, you can feel the LGUs at work, with most roads cleared and establishments starting to open. Catanduanos have played a big part with their sense of community: bigger and sturdier houses taking in those in smaller ones, looking out for neighbors. https://t.co/vkUY8cwYRK

Visited Virac and Bato in Catanduanes this morning. Heartbreaking to see the devastation at every turn. Houses big or small destroyed, establishments‚Äîfrom school buildings to govt facilities and churches‚Äîas well. All electric posts were down. No electricity and phone signal. https://t.co/vir2umKwcU

Again, many thanks to @michdulce for the initiative & many sleepless nights, & to her colleagues who answered the call. You guys are the best!üáµüá≠ Thanks to Dr. Espiritu & Dr. Ancheta for guiding us through this. 

(& thank you, everyone, for indulging me w/ this long storyüòÖ)

W/ this, we can go full steam into production now. We will be producing in bulk, but you can all have our local mananahis make them for frontliners in your areas, esp. for those in provinces‚Äîjust make sure to use Tafetta SBL. 8/

This suit is reusable & the pattern is available for EVERYONE‚Äôs use. You can access the open source pattern & techpack here: https://t.co/QGFKktLs63 

This pattern is for LARGE. Coming up: Small & Medium + a 2-pc version to make bathroom breaks easier for our frontliners. 7/

(Here comes the good part!!!ü•≥)

It took us more than 48 hrs of going back & forth‚Äîuntil this afternoon, we got word that, finally, our prototype has been approved! This one was made by Joey Socco using Tafetta Silver Back Lining, suggested & donated by Dr. Reina Tajonera. 6/

We didn‚Äôt want to take our chances; the suit has to adequately protect our health workers. Dr. Cesar Espiritu, President/CEO of Medical City South Luzon linked us to Dr. Jesus Julio Ancheta, an infectious diseases expert, who helped check our prototypes & materials on hand. 5/

The design was medically reviewed in Berkeley, CA. It was recommended we use the material Tyvek, a construction material common in hardware stores outside PH. We ended up looking for similar materials from local suppliers, w/ our frontliners‚Äô protection as main consideration. 4/

.@michdulce didn‚Äôt just reverse-engineer the suit we gave her‚Äîshe called for reinforcement from her fellow fashion designers, who committed to the project, too. In just a day, they were able to come up w/ a pattern and a techpack now available online for everyone‚Äôs use. 3/

This was made possible by designers who stepped up to help create a locally-produced protective suit. We made this call a few days ago amid the volume of requests & challenges in sourcing PPEs. Our dear friend @michdulce answered in just a few hrs, asking for a sample. 2/

Amid these difficult times, we find light in the true spirit of bayanihan. Today‚Äôs silver lining is c/o our talented homegrown fashion designers. Borrowing a term from my young staff‚Äî

TL;DR: Our prototype for a protective suit for medical frontliners has been approved!!!ü•≥ 1/ https://t.co/krIVcW0e27

Our office is committed to respond to the many requests, including #PPEForEasternVisayas. Pls bear w/ us as we work thru challenges re: availability of supplies. Now coordinating w/ orgs to deliver to E. Samar. Rest assured we're doing our best to respond as soon as we can. https://t.co/RHXFYxVcdd

Patuloy po nating ipaglalaban ang karapatan ng mga tao na malayang ihayag ang kanilang sariling opinyon. Sa lahat ng kritiko, go ahead. Ang kritisismo ay parte ng demokrasya.

Magtulungan nalang tayo sa pagseserbisyo para sa interes at kapakanan ng bawat Pilipino.

Marami pong mga isyu sa ating bayan na pwede nating ayusin kung magtutulungan tayo. Ang pinaka-magandang tulong na pwede ninyong gawin ay ang huwag dumagdag sa problema sa pamamagitan ng pagpapakalat ng fake news.

Ito ay fake news. 

Huwag ninyo aksayahin ang inyong oras sa pagpapakalat ng mga fake news. Maraming manloloko, huwag kayong magpapaloko. Sa mga nagpapakalat ng fake news upang linlangin ang ating mga kababayan, hindi ako mag-aalinlangan na panagutin kayo.

Lahat ng mga mahahalagang sinabi ko at posisyon ko sa mga iba‚Äôt ibang usapin ay nasa aking official website at official socmed accounts. Ang anumang pinapakalat na mga "balita" umano na hindi naman nanggaling sa akin mismo o opisyal na nilabas ng aking opisina ay hindi totoo.

Maraming manlolokong walang magawa! Huwag kayo magpaloko sa fake news!

Nitong mga nakaraang araw, merong mga kumakalat na impormasyon umano na taliwas naman sa aktwal kong sinabi. Itong mga fake news na ito ay pawang paninira lamang at panlilinlang sa ating mga kababayan.

Final question: "If elected, what would be your priority legislation?"
Ka Leody: Ipantay rin dapat ang sahod ng mga manggagawa sa buong bansa, at saka i-kontrol rin ang presyo. Kilalanin rin natin sila bilang taga-paglikha ng kaunlaran sa ating produksyon sa lipunan. 2/2

Final question: "If elected, what would be your priority legislation?"
Ka Leody: Pag-regular sa ating mga manggagawa. Bilang tao regular ang kanilang mga pangangailangan, kaya dapat regular rin ang kanilang mga trabaho.  1/2

Question: "Where do your social media spendings come from?"
Ka Leody: Galing sa aking organisasyon, partido, at mga manggagawa.

Question: "What measures would you put in place to further improve women's rights in the country?"
Ka Leody: Bigyan rin ng gobyerno ng allowance o sweldo ang mga asawa na nasa bahay lamang at saka libreng pang-ospital. 2/2

Question: "What measures would you put in place to further improve women's rights in the country?"
Ka Leody: Kailangan nating suportahan ang mga kababaihan bilang kapantay ang bilang nga kalalakihan at dapat i-reinforce ang kanilang mga karapatan. 1/2

Question: "Do you support giving the president emergency powers to solve EDSA traffic?"
Ka Leody: Hindi sa termino ni pangulong Duterte dahil delikado at baka magamit ito sa masama. I-shift sana ang sistema ng transportasyon sa mass transport tulad ng sa South Korea.
ERRATUM: 2/2 not 1/2

Question from audience: "Malaking factor ba ang pagsasabi ng katotohonan bilang public servant at bakit?"
Ka Leody: Pero ang mga lider-manggagawa, hindi sila mga sinungalin, dahil hindi nila nais magpayaman sa kanilang puwesto. 1/2

Question from audience: "Malaking factor ba ang pagsasabi ng katotohonan bilang public servant at bakit?"
Ka Leody: Mukhang may punto naman si Sarah, dahil ang mga trapo, mga pulitiko na intensyon lamang na magpayaman lamang, lahat naman sila'y nagsisinungalin. 1/2

Question: "What can you do for the Filipino people?"
Ka Leody: Mga kahilingan ng mga manggagawa na matagal nang sinisigaw tulad ng regular na trabaho ay dapat tugunan ng gobyerno sa pamamagitan ng paggawa ng pambansang mga industriya para sila'y makapagtrabaho sa ating bansa.

Question: "What is your stand on having a national minimum wage?"
Ka Leody: Parehas rin naman ang epekto ng mga taxes tulad ng VAT sa buong bansa, kaya bakit hindi rin gawing parehas rin ang sahod ng mga manggagawa sa buong bansa? 2/2

Question: "What is your stand on having a national minimum wage?"
Ka Leody: Sang-ayon ako dahil national talaga noon ang minimum wage at umunlad ang mga negosyante. Hindi rin totoo na mas mura ang mga produkto sa probinsya, dahil minsan pa nga'y mas mataas ang inflation doon. 1/2

Question: "How can we expand efforts to clean the air to other parts of the country?"
Ka Leody: Ipasara ang mga coal mine na ang pinakamaruming enerhiyang ginagamit sa bansa na nagco-contribute sa pag-init ng mundo at climate change na nagreresulta sa mga bagyo tulad ng Yolanda.

Question from audience: "What plans do you have if you lose the elections?"
Ka Leody: Tuloy lang ang aking ginawa sa nakalipas na 35 years na pagtulong sa ating mga manggagawa -- ilaban ang trabahong regular, ang national minimum wage, at price control sa mga bilihin.

Question: "Kung senator ka ngayon, anong gagawin mo ngayon sa measles outbreak?"
Ka Leody: Dapat magkaroon ng malawakang information campaign ang ating pamahalaan, at dapat ayusin rin ang pag-sensationalize ng Dengvaxia na ginamit ng mga pulitiko laban sa kanilang mga kalaban.

Question: "Should the narco-list be released? Yes or no?"
Ka Leody: May violation kasi sa demokratikong proseso. Kung talagang matibay ang ebidensiya ng ating pamahalaan, e kasuhan na lang ang mga pinagbibintangan at iharap sa husgado silang lahat.

Question: "Should we proceed with these reclamation projects in Manila Bay? Yes or no?"
Ka Leody: No

Question: "Why are you running for senator?"
Ka Leody: Tumakbo ako bilang senador dahil gusto kong magkaroon ng kinatawan ang mga manggagawa sa loob ng senado. Sila ay bumubuo ng pinakalaking porsyento ng ating mga mamamayan, ngunit hanggang ngayon wala pa rin silang kinatawan

Final words (2/2):

Final words (1/2):

#ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Fast talk (2/2):

Idol: Pabirong si JV Ejercito
Papanigan na alyansa: Labor Win
Transport: Dapat mass transport
No to single-use vehicles: Dapat lang

#ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Fast talk (1/2):

Tanggalin ang wage board: Dapat
Batas laban sa Endo: Definitely
Term Limits: Hindi
Death Penalty: Hindi 
Anti-drug policy: Hindi sa paraang pagpatay

#ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Para sa kabataan: Walang available na trabaho dahil walang programa ang gobyerno na gumawa ng sustainable jobs. Maglaan ng sapat na pondo para sa ikauunlad ng mga industriya  #ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Diskriminasyon ng trabaho sa may edad: Diskriminasyon ay produkto ng polisiya ng gobyerno na hindi gumawa ng permanenteng trabaho dito kaya napipilitang magabroad sila. Dapat lumikha ng sustainable jobs. #ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Mapababa ang presyo ng krudo: Deregulated ang pagtaas ng presyo ng krudo pero regulated ang kita ng mga driver. Reviewhin at baliktarin ang oil regulation law at suspendehin ang TRAIN law dahil dapat proteksyunan ng gobyerno ang mga mamamayan. #ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman

Paano ba matutungulan ang mga kababayang kailangang magpagamot: 
Ang problema ay ang patakarang pina-privatize ang mga ospital at ginagawang negosyo. Dapat baliktarin at akuin ng gobyerno ang kalusugan ng mamamayan.  #ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman
Pangarap sa senado at pangunahing batas: Senado ng manggagawa at ng masang Pilipino, hindi ng iilan. Trabahong regular, hindi kontraktwal. #ManggagawaNaman #23DeGuzman
